article_title: Corporate America Saves $3 Trillion by Putting Retirees on Obamacare
article_text: You need to LOG IN to edit your watchlist.

article_metadata.description: IBM (IBM), Wal-Mart (WMT), Time Warner (TWX), Alcoa (AA) and GE (GE) are among those saving trillions of dollars by pushing workers and retirees off company-sponsored health plans onto less costly exchanges.
article_metadata.author: James Passeri

og.description: IBM, Wal-Mart, Time Warner, Alcoa and GE are among those saving trillions of dollars by pushing workers and retirees off company-sponsored health plans onto less costly exchanges.
og.title: Companies are using Obamacare to cut your health benefits
